page.title: 03FARMING : A WEARDALE FARM(2)
page.content:
Our cattle are Aberdeen AngusX,and GalawayX cows which all breed Limousin calves. We have 65 cows altogether. All are beef cows. In the winter we keep the cows inside at Weeds but they sometimes go to Killhope in the summer.
Our crops are silage and hay we buy straw as well. They used to be all hay but we changed to silage in 1982. The most important times of year are lambing time, the auction sales and looking after the stock in winter.
{NB.}Some Weardale farmers are now changing from the traditional hay crop to silage production. 1985 was a particularly wet summer and it was very difficult to harvest the hay.
